text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ea563cc22be043ff91dcbdf2878c3d1fd944e573|patch 8.2.0906: when setting 'termguicolors' SpellBad is no longer red>
patch 8.2.0906: when setting 'termguicolors' SpellBad is no longer red

Problem:    When setting 'termguicolors' SpellBad is no longer red.
Solution:   Only use the RGB guisp color for cterm when using the "underline"
            or "undercurl" attributes to avoid the background color to be
            cleared. Also make t_8u empty when the termresponse indicates a
            real xterm. (closes #6207)

attachments.text: Problem: When setting &#39;termguicolors&#39; SpellBad is no longer red. Solution: Only use the RGB guisp color for cterm when using the &quot;underline&quot; or &quot;undercurl&qu...

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/07188fc5ef2366a3b1952e8686a4031b44152d59|patch 8.2.0907: when using :global clipboard isn't set correctly>
patch 8.2.0907: when using :global clipboard isn't set correctly

Problem:    When using :global clipboard isn't set correctly.
Solution:   Set "clip_unnamed_saved" instead of "clip_unnamed". (Christian
            Brabandt, closes #6203, closes #6198)

attachments.text: Problem: When using :global clipboard isn&#39;t set correctly. Solution: Set &quot;clip_unnamed_saved&quot; instead of &quot;clip_unnamed&quot;. (Christian Brabandt, closes #6203, ...

text:

patch 8.2.0908: crash when changing the function table while listing it

Problem:    Crash when changing the function table while listing it.
Solution:   Bail out when the function table changes. (closes #6209)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/002bc79991286934a9593b80635c27d4238cdfc4|patch 8.2.0909: cannot go back to the previous local directory>
patch 8.2.0909: cannot go back to the previous local directory

Problem:    Cannot go back to the previous local directory.
Solution:   Add "tcd -" and "lcd -". (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #4362)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0909: cannot go back to the previous local directory · vim/vim@002bc79

attachments.text: Problem: Cannot go back to the previous local directory. Solution: Add "tcd -" and "lcd -". (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #4362)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8f1dde5021d9623a951d1ccbc78cf1b1a55ccd7a|patch 8.2.0910: Vim is not reproducibly buildable>
patch 8.2.0910: Vim is not reproducibly buildable

Problem:    Vim is not reproducibly buildable.
Solution:   Use the $SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH environment variable in configure.
            (James McCoy, closes #513)  Give a warning about using it.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0910: Vim is not reproducibly buildable · vim/vim@8f1dde5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0910: Vim is not reproducibly buildable · vim/vim@8f1dde5
attachments.text: Problem: Vim is not reproducibly buildable. Solution: Use the $SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH environment variable in configure. (James McCoy, closes #513) Give a warning about using it.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9b7cce28d568f0622d77c6c9878c2d4770c3b164|patch 8.2.0911: crash when opening a buffer for the cmdline window fails>
patch 8.2.0911: crash when opening a buffer for the cmdline window fails

Problem:    Crash when opening a buffer for the cmdline window fails. (Chris
            Barber)
Solution:   Check do_ecmd() succeeds.  Reset got_int if "q" was used at the
            more prompt. (closes #6211)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/d8df304c59040ef6689a1e4af1dac27ce566909e|patch 8.2.0914: MS-Windows: cannot specify a "modified by" text>
patch 8.2.0914: MS-Windows: cannot specify a "modified by" text

Problem:    MS-Windows: cannot specify a "modified by" text.
Solution:   Add MODIFIED_BY in the MSVC build file.  (Chen Lei, closes #1275)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0914: MS-Windows: cannot specify a "modified by" text · vim/vim@d8df304
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0914: MS-Windows: cannot specify a "modified by" text · vim/vim@d8df304
attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows: cannot specify a "modified by" text. Solution: Add MODIFIED_BY in the MSVC build file. (Chen Lei, closes #1275)
